author: SomaSaysMeep

text:
@SomaSaysMeep Everyone's always "Symphony of the Night this" and "Symphony of the Night that" But it all honesty, I don't really understand why. It's one of my favorite games in the series, and I love it. But it still confuses me a bit: I know that a lot of people praise it for being so fast paced. Well, I feel like it's a bit.........TOO fast paced. Bosses end too quickly, and they're usually pretty lame (except for Succubus, Galamoth, and Olrox). The game is just too easy, and the Inverted Castle?: SssssssssssssssTUPID. I'm sorry, but it just feels repetitive going through the same castle again. I know Portrait of Ruin (no clue why people hate that game so much) uses pallete swaps from previous areas, but the atmosphere and music feels completely different. BUTT: I'm not saying Symphony of the Night is bad. It's awesome. Go watch SomecallmeJohnnie's review and you'll see why. I just think that when it comes to the Metroidvania games, Dawn of Sorrow, Aria of Sorrow, and especially Portrait of Ruin are better.

SO.......what did we learn from this short rant/mini-review?

A. Castlevania is underrated.

B. I was incredibly bored while making this comment.

author: YolmzWelra

text: You must be reading my mind lately, SupraDarky. I've been learning how to play this and the Arena theme on guitar and having a blast. Put together, the three GBA Castlevanias boast some of the Konami team's greatest musical output. While a lot of people feel obligated to harp on the limitations of the hardware, I think it's important to look past that and recognize that the compositions themselves are simply awesome and very well-arranged.

text: Here I was hoping that IGA would get to keep making Metroidvanias on the handhelds, looks like I was unfortunately wrong. No more Michiru Yamane as well which is a travesty. With these games, I'd actually stop and listen to the music when I entered a new area because I knew there was a good chance it would be awesome. There's also Kojima, what a great artist she is. Look at this cover, then look at the art for Dawn of Sorrow without Kojima,﻿ I was very disapointed back then.
